results.headline: Review: ‘Like for Likes,’ a Rom-Com Set in Seoul
results.summary_short: Relationships unfold with a bright, glossy and antiseptic sentimentality in Park Hyun-gene’s film about loosely connected singles.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Like for Likes

results.headline: Review: ‘King Georges’ Chronicles a Famed Restaurant’s Downfall
results.summary_short: This documentary focuses on the chef Georges Perrier and Le Bec-Fin, his Philadelphia fixture that closed in 2013 after four decades in business.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of King Georges

results.headline: Review: ‘Eddie the Eagle’ Revels in Its Underdog Status
results.summary_short: The film is a heavily fictionalized version of Eddie Edwards’s competition as a ski jumper at the 1988 Winter Olympics.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eddie the Eagle

results.headline: Review: In ‘Backtrack,’ Adrien Brody Treats Dead People
results.summary_short: The echoes of “The Sixth Sense” are to be expected, but this film about a troubled psychologist is another animal entirely.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Backtrack

results.headline: Review: In ‘Triple 9,’ an Appealing Cast Can’t Rise Above the Violence
results.summary_short: The film is one of those productions in which much of the creative energy has been funneled into gaudily inventive displays of brutality.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Triple 9

results.headline: Review: ‘Jack of the Red Hearts’: Trouble Babysits Trouble
results.summary_short: A wily impostor weasels her way into being the caregiver for an uncontrollable 11-year-old girl who is autistic.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jack of the Red Hearts

results.headline: Review: In ‘Gods of Egypt,’ That Doughnut Beast Is Stepping on My Sandal
results.summary_short: Alex Proyas’s special-effects extravaganza, set in antiquity, is an embarrassment of kitsch riches with intermittent moments of wit.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gods of Egypt

results.headline: Review: ‘The Mermaid’ Features Stephen Chow Behind the Camera
results.summary_short: This slapstick eco-fable and love story has, in addition to mermaids, a half-octopus and a femme fatale.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Mermaid

results.headline: Review: Twisted Sister’s Hard Road and Drummer Shortage
results.summary_short: Directed by Andrew Horn, “We Are Twisted_______ Sister!” chronicles the rock band’s difficult path to making it in the music business.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of We Are Twisted ______ Sister!

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Witch,’ a Family’s Contract With God Is Tested
results.summary_short: Around 1630 in New England, a family leaves a plantation to settle down alone at the edge of a forest.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Witch

results.headline: Review: ‘Rolling Papers’ Follows The Denver Post on the Marijuana Beat
results.summary_short: This documentary follows Ricardo Baca and several of his writers throughout 2014 as they define their new beat.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rolling Papers

results.headline: Review: In ‘Diamond Tongues,’ Leah Goldstein Plays a Flawed Actress
results.summary_short: Ms. Goldstein’s character is resentful and disarming as she tries to make it in show business in Toronto.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Diamond Tongues

results.headline: Review: In ‘Forsaken,’ the Sutherlands Bond in the Old West
results.summary_short: A gunslinger returns to his hometown and encounters challenges as he reconnects with his father in this film set in 1872.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Forsaken

results.headline: Review: ‘Risen,’ a Tale of Conversion Starring Joseph Fiennes
results.summary_short: The producers, in trying to appeal to believers and nonbelievers alike, aim for drama in the story of Clavius, a Roman army tribune.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Risen

results.headline: Review: ‘Snowtime!’ Tells of an Escalating Snowball War
results.summary_short: This animated movie, intended for a young audience, is a remake of a 1984 film called “The Dog Who Stopped the War.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Snowtime!

results.headline: Review: ‘Race’ Chronicles Jesse Owens’s Rise to Olympic Glory
results.summary_short: Stephen Hopkins’s film takes one of the least challenging paths in telling Owens’s story, confining its time span to three years, from 1934 to 1936.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Race

results.headline: Review: ‘Embrace of the Serpent,’ Where Majesty Meets Monstrosity
results.summary_short: Ciro Guerra’s film explores the devastation of the Amazon jungle through two historical journeys and the viewpoint of a fictional tribal shaman.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Embrace of the Serpent

results.headline: Review: ‘Touched With Fire,’ a Love Story Between Two Bipolar Poets
results.summary_short: Katie Holmes and Luke Kirby play bright, high-strung artists struggling with depression in this film by Paul Dalio.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Touched With Fire

results.headline: Review: In ‘Mountains May Depart,’ Jia Zhangke Shows a Changing China
results.summary_short: The film, which begins in 1999, shows changes in personal relationships and in the country itself.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mountains May Depart

results.headline: Review: ‘Fitoor’ Enlists Dickens to Tell a Hindi Love Story
results.summary_short: Based on “Great Expectations,” the film, directed by Abhishek Kapoor, is more Bollywood than Charles Dickens.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fitoor
